forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely before 5pm, then a slight chance of showers and thunderstorms. Partly sunny. High near 55, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. West wind 15 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Showers And Thunderstorms then Mostly Clear
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of showers and thunderstorms before 11pm. Mostly clear. Low around 44, with temperatures rising to around 46 overnight. Northwest wind 10 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this afternoon, the skies are a quirky blend of sun and clouds, punctuated by the lingering possibility of rain showers that flirt with the city until around dinnertime. A chill wraps around you, with a high of 55 degrees that will dip into the low 50s as the day progresses, ushered along by a westerly breeze whispering through the streets at a steady 15 to 18 mph. The 70% chance of precipitation casts a shadow of uncertainty over the afternoon, where any warmth wrestles with the cool, crisp air, creating an ambiance perfect for reflective wandering or cozy cafes.

As the evening unfolds, you might find that the threat of showers diminishes, leaving behind mostly clear skies punctuated by an occasional star or two. The temperatures will dip, settling around 44 degrees, rising slightly as the night deepens. A light jacket and comfortable layers will serve you well, allowing you to appreciate the remnants of daylight and the twilight glow without succumbing to the evening chill. Perhaps you consider an evening stroll along the Embarcadero, where the city lights dance on the bay, or a visit to a quirky bookstore to shelter from the cool breeze and indulge in the magic of an evening spent perusing new worlds between the covers of forgotten tales.
